query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Già si godeva solo del suo verbo 2 quello specchio beato, e io gustava 3 lo mio, temprando col dolce l’acerbo;
query.error: **English:** 1 Already he enjoyed alone his word, 2 that blessed mirror, and I savored 3 mine, tempering the bitter with the sweet;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 e quella donna ch’a Dio mi menava 5 disse: «Muta pensier; pensa ch’i’ sono 6 presso a colui ch’ogne torto disgrava».
query.error: **English:** 4 and that lady who was leading me to God 5 said: "Change your thought; think that I am 6 near to him who rights every wrong."
query.result: 4 and seo fæmne þe me to Gode lædde 5 cwæð: "Wende þinne geþoht; þenc þæt ic eom 6 neah þam þe ælc unriht geriht."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 Io mi rivolsi a l’amoroso suono 8 del mio conforto; e qual io allor vidi 9 ne li occhi santi amor, qui l’abbandono:
query.error: **English:** 7 I turned to the loving sound 8 of my comfort; and what I saw then 9 in those holy eyes, love, I abandon here:
query.result: 7 Ic me gewende to ðæm wynlicum swēge 8 mines gefēran; and hwæt ic ðā geseah 9 on ðām hālgum ēagum, lufu, ðæt ic hēr forlǣte:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 non perch’ io pur del mio parlar diffidi, 11 ma per la mente che non può redire 12 sovra sé tanto, s’altri non la guidi.
query.error: **English:** 10 not because I doubt my own speech, 11 but because the mind cannot return 12 to itself so far, unless another guides it.
query.result: 10 nā forðæm ðe ic ðēah ðurh mīne sprǣce twēoge, 11 ac for ðǣre gemynde ðe ne mæg eft cuman 12 ofer hīe self swa fēor, būton ōðer hīe læde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Tanto poss’ io di quel punto ridire, 14 che, rimirando lei, lo mio affetto 15 libero fu da ogne altro disire,
query.error: **English:** 13 So much can I say of that moment, 14 that, looking at her, my affection 15 was freed from every other desire,
query.result: 13 Swa micel mæg ic secgan ðæs stealles, 14 ðæt, ða ic on ða wlite locade, min willa 15 wæs freoh from ælce oðrum wilnunge,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 fin che ’l piacere etterno, che diretto 17 raggiava in Bëatrice, dal bel viso 18 mi contentava col secondo aspetto.
query.error: **English:** 16 until the eternal pleasure, which shone directly 17 in Beatrice, from her beautiful face 18 contented me with its secondary aspect.
query.result: 16 oð ðæt ðæt ece wuldor, ðe scineð 17 on ðære fægran Beatričan, of ðam fægran ansyne 18 me gefylde mid ðam oðrum ansyne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Vincendo me col lume d’un sorriso, 20 ella mi disse: «Volgiti e ascolta; 21 ché non pur ne’ miei occhi è paradiso».
query.error: **English:** 19 Conquering me with the light of a smile, 20 she said to me: "Turn and listen; 21 for not only in my eyes is paradise."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Come si vede qui alcuna volta 23 l’affetto ne la vista, s’elli è tanto, 24 che da lui sia tutta l’anima tolta,
query.error: **English:** 22 As one sometimes sees here 23 the affection in the sight, if it is so strong, 24 that the whole soul is taken by it,
query.result: 22 Swa man hwilum hēr gesihð 23 ðone lufu on ðære gesihðe, gif he ðæs swiðe lyt, 24 ðæt of him bið eal seo sawl ātogen,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 così nel fiammeggiar del folgór santo, 26 a ch’io mi volsi, conobbi la voglia 27 in lui di ragionarmi ancora alquanto.
query.error: **English:** 25 so in the flashing of the holy lightning, 26 to which I turned, I recognized the desire 27 in him to speak with me for a while longer.
query.result: 25 swā on ðæs ligetes līgæs fyre, 26 ðær ic me to gewende, ic ðā ðæs willan oncneow 27 on him ðæt hē mē wolde ðā gēt sprecan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 El cominciò: «In questa quinta soglia 29 de l’albero che vive de la cima 30 e frutta sempre e mai non perde foglia,
query.error: **English:** 28 He began: "In this fifth circle 29 of the tree that lives from its top 30 and bears fruit always and never loses its leaves,
query.result: 28 He ongan ða: "On ðysse fiftan twige 29 ðæs treowes ðe leofað of ðære heanesse 30 and wæstmas æfre and næfre leaf ne tyneð,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 spiriti son beati, che giù, prima 32 che venissero al ciel, fuor di gran voce, 33 sì ch’ogne musa ne sarebbe opima.
query.error: **English:** 31 are blessed spirits, who down below, before 32 they came to heaven, were of great renown, 33 so that every muse would be enriched by them.
query.result: 31 synt ða gastas ða gesæligan, ða ðe her nyðer, ær 32 ðe hi to heofonum comon, wæron ðæs miclan hleoðes, 33 ðæt æghwylc mægð ðæs wære wynsum."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Però mira ne’ corni de la croce: 35 quello ch’io nomerò, lì farà l’atto 36 che fa in nube il suo foco veloce».
query.error: **English:** 34 Therefore, look at the horns of the cross: 35 the one that I will name, there will make the gesture 36 that his swift fire makes in the clouds.
query.result: 34 Forðæm beheald nu on ðæs rôde hornum: 35 se ðe ic nemne, ðær he wyrceð ðone sið 36 ðe his fyrenu swifte on wolcnum doð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Io vidi per la croce un lume tratto 38 dal nomar Iosuè, com’ el si feo; 39 né mi fu noto il dir prima che ’l fatto.
query.error: **English:** 37 I saw a light drawn forth by the cross 38 from the name of Joshua, as he did; 39 and the telling was not known to me before the deed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 E al nome de l’alto Macabeo 41 vidi moversi un altro roteando, 42 e letizia era ferza del paleo.
query.error: **English:** 40 And in the name of the noble Maccabee 41 I saw another move, whirling around, 42 and joy was the whip of the top.
query.result: 40 And on ðæs hehstan Machabeus naman 41 ic geseah oðerne on hweorfe hweorfan, 42 and ðæs swæges wyn wæs ðæs swipan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 Così per Carlo Magno e per Orlando 44 due ne seguì lo mio attento sguardo, 45 com’ occhio segue suo falcon volando.
query.error: **English:** 43 Thus for Charlemagne and for Orlando 44 my attentive gaze followed two, 45 as an eye follows its falcon flying.
query.result: 43 Swa forð Carle and for Orfeo 44 twegen ic folgode ðurh ðone ðicgan hagosteald, 45 swa ðæt eage ðone hafoc ðe he on handa bær.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 Poscia trasse Guiglielmo e Rinoardo 47 e ’l duca Gottifredi la mia vista 48 per quella croce, e Ruberto Guiscardo.
query.error: **English:** 46 Then William and Rinaldo drew near, 47 and Duke Godfrey caught my sight, 48 by that cross, and Robert Guiscard.
query.result: 46 Þa wæs Guillielm and Reinard 47 and ðe heretoga Godefrei min gesiho 48 be ðære rode, and Rodbert Guiscard.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Indi, tra l’altre luci mota e mista, 50 mostrommi l’alma che m’avea parlato 51 qual era tra i cantor del cielo artista.
query.error: **English:** 49 Then, among the other lights, moved and mingled, 50 the soul who had spoken to me 51 showed me who among the singers of heaven was an artist.
query.result: 49 Þa, betwux ðam oðrum leohtum astyred and gemenged, 50 ætywde me se gast ðe me ær spræc, 51 hwylc wære on ðam heofoncantorum wyrhta.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 Io mi rivolsi dal mio destro lato 53 per vedere in Beatrice il mio dovere, 54 o per parlare o per atto, segnato;
query.error: **English:** 52 I turned from my right side 53 to see in Beatrice my duty, 54 either by speech or by some other sign;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 e vidi le sue luci tanto mere, 56 tanto gioconde, che la sua sembianza 57 vinceva li altri e l’ultimo solere.
query.error: **English:** 55 and I saw her eyes so full of joy, 56 so joyous, that her appearance 57 surpassed the other and the highest sun.
query.result: 55 and ic geseah hire leoht swa micel, 56 swa myrige, ðæt hire ansyn 57 oferwann ða oðre and ðone hehstan sunnan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 E come, per sentir più dilettanza 59 bene operando, l’uom di giorno in giorno 60 s’accorge che la sua virtute avanza,
query.error: **English:** 58 And as, in order to feel more delight 59 in doing good, a man from day to day 60 perceives that his virtue is advancing,
query.result: 58 And swa swa man, for ðon ðe he wille mare 59 wel wyrcande, ðone dag be dæge 60 ongit ðæt his mægen weorðe mare,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 sì m’accors’ io che ’l mio girare intorno 62 col cielo insieme avea cresciuto l’arco, 63 veggendo quel miracol più addorno.
query.error: **English:** 61 so I perceived that my circling around 62 with the heavens had increased the arc, 63 seeing that miracle more adorned.
query.result: 61 swa ic onget ðæt min gang ymbutan 62 mid ðam heofone hæfde weaxen ðone bogan, 63 ða ic ðæt wundor geseah weorðlicor.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 E qual è ’l trasmutare in picciol varco 65 di tempo in bianca donna, quando ’l volto 66 suo si discarchi di vergogna il carco,
query.error: **English:** 64 And as is the transformation in a short space 65 of time into a white woman, when her face 66 unburdens itself of the burden of shame,
query.result: 64 And swa swa is ðære wendan on lytlum fæce 65 timan to hwitre wīfe, ðonne ðæs wlite 66 hire ansīen bið gescyrped sārnesse,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 tal fu ne li occhi miei, quando fui vòlto, 68 per lo candor de la temprata stella 69 sesta, che dentro a sé m’avea ricolto.
query.error: **English:** 67 such was it in my eyes, when I turned, 68 because of the brightness of the temperate star 69 of the sixth hour, which had received me within itself.
query.result: 67 swylc wæs on mīnum ēagum, ðā ic wæs gewend, 68 ðurh ðæs wederes glēam ðære gemetgodan steorran 69 sixtan, se ðe on his inngeþanc me hæfde underfangen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 Io vidi in quella giovïal facella 71 lo sfavillar de l’amor che lì era 72 segnare a li occhi miei nostra favella.
query.error: **English:** 70 I saw in that youthful face 71 the sparkling of the love that was there 72 signifying to my eyes our speech.
query.result: 70 Ic geseah on ðære geogoðan nebban 71 ðone leoman ðæs lufe ðe ðær wæs 72 tacnian to minum eagum ure spræce.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 E come augelli surti di rivera, 74 quasi congratulando a lor pasture, 75 fanno di sé or tonda or altra schiera,
query.error: **English:** 73 And as birds that issue forth from a riverbank, 74 as if congratulating each other on their feeding grounds, 75 make of themselves now a round flock, now another formation,
query.result: 73 And swa fugelas ðe ut of ðære ea liggeð, 74 swa swa hi ðam felda gefegon hæbben, 75 doð ðara flocca gehwelcne,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 sì dentro ai lumi sante creature 77 volitando cantavano, e faciensi 78 or D, or I, or L in sue figure.
query.error: **English:** 76 so within the lights the holy creatures 77 flew about singing, and formed themselves 78 now into a D, now an I, now an L, with their figures.
query.result: 76 swa ða halgan ðing ðær binnan ðam leohte 77 flugon and sungon, and ða gesceapa macodon 78 ðæt hi ðær ða ða D and ða ða I and ða ða L mid heora lichoman awriton.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Prima, cantando, a sua nota moviensi; 80 poi, diventando l’un di questi segni, 81 un poco s’arrestavano e taciensi.
query.error: **English:** 79 First, singing, they moved to their own tune; 80 then, becoming one of these signs, 81 they would stop for a while and be silent.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 O diva Pegasëa che li ’ngegni 83 fai glorïosi e rendili longevi, 84 ed essi teco le cittadi e ’ regni,
query.error: **English:** 82 O divine Pegasus, who makes 83 intellects glorious and grants them long life, 84 and with you, cities and kingdoms,
query.result: 82 Eala, ðu mære mearh ðe ða môd ða 83 wyrðeð wuldorful and him lif forgeaf, 84 and ðu mid him ða burg and ða rîcu,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 illustrami di te, sì ch’io rilevi 86 le lor figure com’ io l’ho concette: 87 paia tua possa in questi versi brevi!
query.error: **English:** 85 enlighten me with yourself, so that I may raise up 86 their forms as I have conceived them: 87 let your power appear in these brief verses!
query.result: 85 onliht mec mid ðe selfum, ðæt ic ârære 86 hira andwlîcu swâ ic hira on môde hæbbe: 87 sî ðîn miht on ðissum scortan feohtum!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Mostrarsi dunque in cinque volte sette 89 vocali e consonanti; e io notai 90 le parti sì, come mi parver dette.
query.error: **English:** 88 Let vowels and consonants show themselves, then, in five times seven; 89 and I noted 90 the parts, just as they seemed to me to be spoken.
query.result: 88 Âtŷwe ða ðîn agen on fîfum seofonum 89 stæfcræftum; and ic ða dæl âwrat 90 swâ swâ hîe mê ðûhten gesæde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 ‘DILIGITE IUSTITIAM’, primai 92 fur verbo e nome di tutto ’l dipinto; 93 ‘QUI IUDICATIS TERRAM’, fur sezzai.
query.error: **English:** 91 ‘LOVE JUSTICE’, first 92 were verb and noun of all the painting; 93 ‘YOU WHO JUDGE THE EARTH’, were the seats.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 Poscia ne l’emme del vocabol quinto 95 rimasero ordinate; sì che Giove 96 pareva argento lì d’oro distinto.
query.error: **English:** 94 Then in the middle of the fifth word 95 they remained arranged; so that Jupiter 96 appeared there of silver distinct from gold.
query.result: 94 Þa on ðæs fiftan wordes fæðme 95 wæron georne gegearwode; swa ðæt Iupiter 96 þær wæs of seolfre gescyred fram golde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 E vidi scendere altre luci dove 98 era il colmo de l’emme, e lì quetarsi 99 cantando, credo, il ben ch’a sé le move.
query.error: **English:** 97 And I saw other lights descend to where 98 the summit of the M was, and there they paused, 99 singing, I believe, the good that moves them to itself.
query.result: 97 And ic geseah oðre leoht nyðer stigan þær 98 wæs ðæs M middel, and þær geswican 99 singende, ic wene, ðæt god ðe hi to him bewegeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 Poi, come nel percuoter d’i ciocchi arsi 101 surgono innumerabili faville, 102 onde li stolti sogliono agurarsi,
query.error: **English:** 100 Then, as from the striking of burning logs 101 innumerable sparks arise, 102 from which the foolish are wont to draw omens,
query.result: 100 Þonne, swa swa on ðæs fyres byrnende 101 unrim talu leohta up astihoð, 102 ðone ða dysigan dom georniað,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 resurger parver quindi più di mille 104 luci e salir, qual assai e qual poco, 105 sì come ’l sol che l’accende sortille;
query.error: **English:** 103 more than a thousand lights seemed to rise again there 104 and to ascend, some much and some little, 105 just as the sun that kindles them ordains;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 e quïetata ciascuna in suo loco, 107 la testa e ’l collo d’un’aguglia vidi 108 rappresentare a quel distinto foco.
query.error: **English:** 106 and when each one had settled in its place, 107 I saw the head and neck of an eagle 108 represented in that distinct fire.
query.result: 106 and ða æghwylc on his stede gewand, 107 ðæs earnæs heafod and hals gelicost 108 on ðam fyre gesawon fægere scinan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Quei che dipinge lì, non ha chi ’l guidi; 110 ma esso guida, e da lui si rammenta 111 quella virtù ch’è forma per li nidi.
query.error: **English:** 109 He who paints there has no one to guide him; 110 but he guides himself, and from himself he recalls 111 that power which is the form for the nests.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 L’altra bëatitudo, che contenta 113 pareva prima d’ingigliarsi a l’emme, 114 con poco moto seguitò la ’mprenta.
query.error: **English:** 112 The other blessedness, which seemed content 113 before becoming an L to blossom, 114 with little movement followed the imprint.
query.result: 112 Seo oðer eadig, ðe ðuhte ðæs georn, 113 ær ðon ðe hit on L wære geliðed, 114 mid lytlum bigange ða gespeore folgode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 O dolce stella, quali e quante gemme 116 mi dimostraro che nostra giustizia 117 effetto sia del ciel che tu ingemme!
query.error: **English:** 115 O sweet star, what and how many gems 116 did you show me that our justice 117 is the effect of the heaven that you adorn with jewels!
query.result: 115 Eala ðu swete steorra, hwylce and hu fela gimmas 116 ðu me æteowdest ðæt ure rihtwisnes 117 sie ðæs heofones wyrc, ðe ðu mid gimmum bewrigen hæfst!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Per ch’io prego la mente in che s’inizia 119 tuo moto e tua virtute, che rimiri 120 ond’ esce il fummo che ’l tuo raggio vizia;
query.error: **English:** 118 Therefore I pray to the mind in which begins 119 your movement and your power, that you look down 120 from where the smoke comes that obscures your ray;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 sì ch’un’altra fïata omai s’adiri 122 del comperare e vender dentro al templo 123 che si murò di segni e di martìri.
query.error: **English:** 121 so that once again you may become angry 122 at the buying and selling within the temple 123 that was built with signs and with martyrs.
query.result: 121 swa ðæt ðu eft sumre tide ðe yrre 122 wið ðam bicge and ðam sylle innan ðam temple 123 ðe mid tacnum and mid martyrum getimbrod wæs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 O milizia del ciel cu’ io contemplo, 125 adora per color che sono in terra 126 tutti svïati dietro al malo essemplo!
query.error: **English:** 124 O heavenly host that I behold, 125 pray for those who are on earth, 126 all the saints who follow the evil example!
query.result: 124 Eala, ðu heofonlice werod ðe ic behealde, 125 gebiddað for ða ðe on eorðan sind, 126 ealle ða halgan ðe ðæm yflan bysne fylgiað!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Già si solea con le spade far guerra; 128 ma or si fa togliendo or qui or quivi 129 lo pan che ’l pïo Padre a nessun serra.
query.error: **English:** 127 War used to be waged with swords; 128 but now it is waged by taking away here and there 129 the bread that the most pious Father does not deny to anyone.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Ma tu che sol per cancellare scrivi, 131 pensa che Pietro e Paulo, che moriro 132 per la vigna che guasti, ancor son vivi.
query.error: **English:** 130 But you who write only to erase, 131 think that Peter and Paul, who died 132 for the vineyard that you are destroying, are still alive.
query.result: 130 Ac ðu ðe ðurh ðæt an ðæt ðu awritest ðæt ðu awyrt, 131 ðence ðæt Petrus and Paulus, ða ðe ðrowodon 132 for ðam wingearde ðe ðu aweste, ða gyt leofað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 Ben puoi tu dire: «I’ ho fermo ’l disiro 134 sì a colui che volle viver solo 135 e che per salti fu tratto al martiro,
query.error: **English:** 133 Well may you say: "I have set my desire 134 so on him who chose to live alone 135 and who for his leaps was dragged to martyrdom,
query.result: 133 Wel maȝ ðu secgan: "Ic hæbbe ðone willan fæst 134 swa to ðam ðe wolde wunian ana 135 and ðe for ðam leape wæs læded to ðam martyrdome,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 ch’io non conosco il pescator né Polo».
query.error: **English:** 136 that I know neither the fisherman nor Paul."
query.result: 136 ðæt ic ne can ðone fiscere ne Paulum."
